Can't get tests to pass tonight...trying tomorrow:
https://github.com/brycefisher/hyper/commit/29c33f59586976ac87b8de1c38bcc48e89d4dcc8

@brycefisher You should be able to replicate something like this https://github.com/hyperium/hyper/blob/388ddf6f3b1ea734bc28f6b161bb9d52643d49a6/src/header/common/expect.rs#L47

issue.title: feat(headers) Add Access-Control-Allow-Credentials header
issue.body:
There is only one acceptable value for this header, "true", so
there header struct is unit-like (no fields nor data inside). See
documentation and tests for more info.

Closes #655

body: @Ryman oh nice, that's exactly what I was looking for!

issue.title: feat(headers): Add Access-Control-Allow-Credentials header
issue.body:
There is only one acceptable value for this header, "true", so
there header struct is unit-like (no fields nor data inside). See
documentation and tests for more info. Case insensitive.

Closes #655

issue.title: Todo list of standard, permanent HTTP headers
issue.body: I noticed when making my reverse proxy that the `Forwarded` header is not implemented, along with a bunch of others. So here's a list of 'permanent HTTP headers with a status of standard' on [IANA's list](https://www.iana.org/assignments/message-headers/message-headers.xhtml), as of 2017-06-28: - [x] Accept: [RFC7231, Section 5.3.2] - [x] Accept-Charset: [RFC7231, Section 5.3.3] - [x] Accept-Encoding: [RFC7231, Section 5.3.4][RFC7694, Section 3] - [x] Accept-Language: [RFC7231, Section 5.3.5] - [ ] Accept-Post: [https://www.w3.org/TR/ldp/] - [x] Accept-Ranges: [RFC7233, Section 2.3] - [ ] Age: [RFC7234, Section 5.1] - [x] Allow: [RFC7231, Section 7.4.1] - [ ] ALPN: [RFC7639, Section 2] - [ ] Alt-Svc: [RFC7838] - [ ] Alt-Used: [RFC7838] - [ ] Authentication-Info: [RFC7615, Section 3] - [x] Authorization: [RFC7235, Section 4.2] - [x] Cache-Control: [RFC7234, Section 5.2] - [ ] CalDAV-Timezones: [RFC7809, Section 7.1] - [x] Connection: [RFC7230, Section 6.1] - [x] Content-Disposition: [RFC6266] - [x] Content-Encoding: [RFC7231, Section 3.1.2.2] - [x] Content-Language: [RFC7231, Section 3.1.3.2] - [x] Content-Length: [RFC7230, Section 3.3.2] - [x] Content-Location: [RFC7231, Section 3.1.4.2] - [x] Content-Range: [RFC7233, Section 4.2] - [x] Content-Type: [RFC7231, Section 3.1.1.5] - [x] Cookie: [RFC6265] - [ ] DASL: [RFC5323] - [ ] DAV: [RFC4918] - [x] Date: [RFC7231, Section 7.1.1.2] - [ ] Depth: [RFC4918] - [ ] Destination: [RFC4918] - [x] ETag: [RFC7232, Section 2.3] - [x] Expect: [RFC7231, Section 5.1.1] - [x] Expires: [RFC7234, Section 5.3] - [ ] Forwarded: [RFC7239] - [x] From: [RFC7231, Section 5.5.1] - [x] Host: [RFC7230, Section 5.4] - [ ] HTTP2-Settings: [RFC7540, Section 3.2.1] - [ ] If: [RFC4918] - [x] If-Match: [RFC7232, Section 3.1] - [x] If-Modified-Since: [RFC7232, Section 3.3] - [x] If-None-Match: [RFC7232, Section 3.2] - [x] If-Range: [RFC7233, Section 3.2] - [ ] If-Schedule-Tag-Match: [RFC6638] - [x] If-Unmodified-Since: [RFC7232, Section 3.4] - [x] Last-Modified: [RFC7232, Section 2.2] - [x] Location: [RFC7231, Section 7.1.2] - [ ] Lock-Token: [RFC4918] - [ ] Max-Forwards: [RFC7231, Section 5.1.2] - [ ] MIME-Version: [RFC7231, Appendix A.1] - [ ] Ordering-Type: [RFC4229] - [x] Origin: [RFC6454] - [ ] Overwrite: [RFC4918] - [ ] Position: [RFC4229] - [x] Pragma: [RFC7234, Section 5.4] - [x] Prefer: [RFC7240] - [x] Preference-Applied: [RFC7240] - [ ] Proxy-Authenticate: [RFC7235, Section 4.3] - [ ] Proxy-Authentication-Info: [RFC7615, Section 4] - [ ] Proxy-Authorization: [RFC7235, Section 4.4] - [ ] Public-Key-Pins: [RFC7469] - [ ] Public-Key-Pins-Report-Only: [RFC7469] - [x] Range: [RFC7233, Section 3.1] - [x] Referer: [RFC7231, Section 5.5.2] - [x] Retry-After: [RFC7231, Section 7.1.3] - [ ] Schedule-Reply: [RFC6638] - [ ] Schedule-Tag: [RFC6638] - [ ] Sec-WebSocket-Accept: [RFC6455] - [ ] Sec-WebSocket-Extensions: [RFC6455] - [ ] Sec-WebSocket-Key: [RFC6455] - [ ] Sec-WebSocket-Protocol: [RFC6455] - [ ] Sec-WebSocket-Version: [RFC6455] - [x] Server: [RFC7231, Section 7.4.2] - [x] Set-Cookie: [RFC6265] - [ ] SLUG: [RFC5023] - [x] Strict-Transport-Security: [RFC6797] - [ ] TE: [RFC7230, Section 4.3] - [ ] Timeout: [RFC4918] - [ ] Topic: [RFC8030, Section 5.4] - [ ] Trailer: [RFC7230, Section 4.4] - [x] Transfer-Encoding: [RFC7230, Section 3.3.1] - [ ] TTL: [RFC8030, Section 5.2] - [ ] Urgency: [RFC8030, Section 5.3] - [x] Upgrade: [RFC7230, Section 6.7] - [x] User-Agent: [RFC7231, Section 5.5.3] - [x] Vary: [RFC7231, Section 7.1.4] - [ ] Via: [RFC7230, Section 5.7.1] - [ ] WWW-Authenticate: [RFC7235, Section 4.1] - [x] Warning: [RFC7234, Section 5.5] We have some other headers not in this list in our `headers::common` module: - [x] Access-Control-* - classed as 'provisional' by IANA - not sure what this means, see #655 - [x] Last-Event-ID - not listed, see #723 - [x] Referer-Policy - not listed, see #850 I'm not sure what we want to do with these - whether we keep them, or move them to another module for clarity. This list will also have to be kept up to date. I copied the HTML and used multiple cursors to make it, but it could be a bit error prone. It's a start at least though!
